data_structures: no explicit data structures beyond input arrays
algorithm_technique: Find the GCD of numsDivide, then find the smallest element in nums that divides this GCD.
problem_summary_simple: Delete minimum elements from nums so its smallest element divides all elements in numsDivide.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates GCD of numsDivide, then finds the smallest element in nums that divides this GCD, returning its count if found, else -1.
key_insights: If an element `x` divides all elements in `numsDivide`, it must divide their greatest common divisor (GCD).
The goal is to find the smallest element in `nums` that satisfies this GCD divisibility condition.
Sorting `nums` can help find the smallest qualifying element faster, but iterating and tracking the minimum is also efficient.
